column4: I created a 100gig partion and I can access it but I can't put files on it, it says I don't have permission..?

I created a 100gig partion and I can access it but I can't put files on it, it says I don't have permission..how do i stop this? I know the password it just says because of lost and found or something...anyone got an idea? I've tried formatting it
Sounds like you may have it mounted ro instead of rw.
You could create a fstab entry for it.
how?
Would first have to see what the device is and what partition you have created.
pastebin the results of fdisk -l
sudo fdisk -l
How do you have it mounted now? mount
mount | pastebinit
http://ubuntu.pastebin.com/ieA0FBuX te_
actually te_ I just want to increase space on my current partition
The partition I am using, but to edit it in gparted I need to unmount it, if I unmount the partition I am currently using what'll happen?
Nothing.
Oh the one you are currently using?  You can not umount it.
How do increase the size of my ubuntu partition then?
kay
I think you need to tell us exactly what you want/need to do?
I wanna increase my ubuntu partition (I am currently using it right now) size without damaging it in any way
What size is / are our hard drives?
You may need to use a boot disk.   (Boot from CD)
And then you can resize the partition you are using now.
http://img714.imageshack.us/i/79443620.png/
